title: [Large-scale] Flipped Learning-based Psychology Lecture Design: Scientific Inquiry Methods and Educational Applications

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational psychological theories and pedagogical concepts, basic knowledge of scientific inquiry methods (hypothesis formulation, experimental design, variable control), and experience in utilizing data analysis tools
context.additional_context: Secondary education psychology lectures for pre-service/in-service teachers. Conducts activities integrating scientific analysis tools (surveys, data visualization, statistical analysis) in a blended learning environment using personal devices (BYOD). Focuses on strengthening learners' inquiry skills and critical thinking.

learning_goals: Learners explain core components of the flipped learning model (pre-learning materials, activity-based classes) and scientific inquiry methods (hypothesis formulation, variable control, experimental design) with ≥80% accuracy

Through group discussions with peer teachers, learners apply core psychology concepts (cognitive development, learning theories, etc.) to actual classroom cases and perform observational and evidence-based analysis (data collection, conclusion derivation)

Based on theories acquired via pre-learning videos and quizzes, learners participate ≥90% in role-play activities in classrooms, experiencing independent/dependent variable control and hypothesis verification processes
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
